com.astamuse.asta4d.web.form.flow.base

Interface FormFlowTraceDataAccessor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, MultiInputStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, OneStepFormHandlerTrait<T>, UpdatableFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>

    public interface FormFlowTraceDataAccessor
    This interface holds the functionalities about trace data persisting.
    Author:
    e-ryu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void clearStoredTraceData(String traceId)
      clear the stored trace map.
      default FormFlowTraceData createEmptyTraceData() 
      default boolean removeTraceDataWhenRetrieving() 
      default FormFlowTraceData retrieveTraceData(String traceId)
      retrieve the stored trace data.
      default boolean skipStoreTraceData(String currentStep, String renderTargetStep, FormFlowTraceData traceData)
      Since we are lacking of necessary step information to judge if we should save or not, we only do the basic judgment for the init step.
      default String storeTraceData(String currentStep, String renderTargetStep, String traceId, FormFlowTraceData traceData)
      Note: In fact, we should not save the trace map when some steps such as init step to avoid unnecessary memory usage, thus we call the #skipSaveTraceMap(String, String, Map) to decide save or not.
      default long traceDataExpireTimeInMilliSeconds()
      Sub classes can override this method to customize how long the form flow trace data will keep alive.

    • Method Detail

      • createEmptyTraceData

        default FormFlowTraceData createEmptyTraceData()

      • storeTraceData

        default String storeTraceData(String currentStep,
                              String renderTargetStep,
                              String traceId,
                              FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        Note: In fact, we should not save the trace map when some steps such as init step to avoid unnecessary memory usage, thus we call the #skipSaveTraceMap(String, String, Map) to decide save or not.

        In other words ,the sub class have the responsibility to tell us save or not by overriding the method #skipSaveTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData).

        Parameters:
        currentStep -
        renderTargetStep -
        traceData -
        Returns:

      • skipStoreTraceData

        default boolean skipStoreTraceData(String currentStep,
                                   String renderTargetStep,
                                   FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        Since we are lacking of necessary step information to judge if we should save or not, we only do the basic judgment for the init step. The sub class have the responsibility to handle other cases.
        See Also:
        ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait#skipSaveTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData)

      • retrieveTraceData

        default FormFlowTraceData retrieveTraceData(String traceId)
        retrieve the stored trace data.
        Parameters:
        traceId -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        #saveTraceMap(String, String, Map)

      • removeTraceDataWhenRetrieving

        default boolean removeTraceDataWhenRetrieving()
        Returns:

      • clearStoredTraceData

        default void clearStoredTraceData(String traceId)
        clear the stored trace map.
        Parameters:
        traceData -
        See Also:
        #saveTraceMap(String, String, Map)

      • traceDataExpireTimeInMilliSeconds

        default long traceDataExpireTimeInMilliSeconds()
        Sub classes can override this method to customize how long the form flow trace data will keep alive.

        The default value is 30 minutes.

        Returns:
